content.rendered:
Buena Vista in the Fall

Autumn is the perfect time to get away for a few days with friends or family as the weather starts to cool down and the aspen trees turn to vibrant shades of yellow. We recommend heading down to Buena Vista located in the Upper Arkansas River Valley for a multitude of special events and activities held throughout the fall.

Gold Rush Days
McPhelemy Park
August 12th & 13th

This free two-day event has been a Buena Vista tradition for thirty-six years and counting. The days will be filled with live music of various genres, food, and activities for all ages. The kids can compete in the rubber ducky race while the adults enjoy music in the beer garden. Some other activities include a burro race, blacksmith demonstrations, a reenactment of an old-time gunfight and many more.

Buena Vista Farmers Market
Fridays from June 2nd to October 14th @ 3-7pm

Come to the South Main Town Square to support the local economy and ecosystem by participating in the weekly BV farmers market where you can purchase food to make yourself or indulge in food that has already been prepared. You can enjoy a day filled with a great selection of fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, pastries, bread, and cheese. Not hungry? That’s okay, there will be local crafters, artists and jewelers selling their homemade creations.

ATV Historic Color Tour
American Legion Hall
September 19th – 21st

This event is perfect for families with ATVs or off-road vehicles that are looking for a weekend away. There is a $95 registration fee that covers four days’ worth of breakfast, a pig roast on Saturday night, a t-shirt, Poker Run and Rodeo Run as well as a booklet that shows all of the possible trail options in the area. This is a self-guided activity, but there will be volunteers driving around if you need assistance or have questions. All proceeds for this event are donated for charity by the Buena Vista Chamber of Commerce.

14er Fest
Main Street
September 29th – October 1st

At the 14er Fest you can join fellow outdoor enthusiasts for a three-day weekend full of fun that includes food, music, and plenty of awesome activities to choose from. Some of the activities offered are biking, hiking, climbing, trail running, fishing and off roading. With clinics and equipment demos this event is perfect for outdoor adventure newcomers or the seasoned expert looking to take their adventures and skills to the next level.

Haunted Nights at Turner Farms
October 29th – 31st // 7:00 – 9:45 PM

Head over to Turner Farms if you are looking for a night filled with monsters, zombies and ghosts. Tickets are $10 per person.

When you visit Buena Visit, you will not be disappointed with the beautiful views and activities for everyone to enjoy. If you would like more information about these events or are looking for even more activities, visit: http://www.buenavistacolorado.org/events/
